intro: Macrosiphonia berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant red, tubular flowers that resemble firecrackers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly hummingbirds, due to their bright color and nectar-rich structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners in warmer climates.
